intro: [WRONG START] Erythranthere gracilipes, commonly known as the slender stalked flowering plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Onagraceae. It is native to the western United States, particularly California, and thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, small blue to purple flowers, and lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in open habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Erythranthe gracilipes is often found in coastal and inland regions, preferring full sun to partial shade.
